TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi beforefieldinit ScrollableControl/DockPaddingEdges extends System.Object implements class System.ICloneable

Docs.summary: Determines the border padding for docked controls.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges> class creates a margin on a given edge or all edges of a docked control. You can set the width of this margin for each individual edge by setting the following properties: <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges.Bottom%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges.Top%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges.Left%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges.Right%2A>. Alternatively, you can set all the edges to the same width simultaneously by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges.All%2A> property. If the size of the control is too large for its container, the control will be resized to fit in the container, minus the specified margin width.
## Examples The following code example uses the derived class, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel>. The example docks a button in a panel control and cycles through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges> properties, setting each individually on the click of the button. This code requires that a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> have been instantiated on a form, and a class-level member variable named `myCounter` has been declared as a 32-bit signed integer. This code should be called on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click> event of the button.
[!code-cpp[Classic ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int All { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.All : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the padding width for all edges of a docked control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The padding width assigned to this property is applied to all edges of the docked control.
## Examples The following code example uses the derived class, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel>. The example docks a button in a panel control and cycles through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges> properties, setting each individually on the click of the button. This code requires that a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> have been instantiated on a form, and a class-level member variable named `myCounter` has been declared as a 32-bit signed integer. This code should be called on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click> event of the button.
[!code-cpp[Classic ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges Example/VB/source.vb#1)]
